docs.lead_paragraph: Paul Volcker, former chairman of the Fed, has agreed to lead a new White House economic advisory committee, President-elect Barack Obama said.

docs.lead_paragraph: Word that Tom Daschle, the former senate majority leader, will be secretary of health and human services and all-around health czar for the Obama administration is shining a spotlight on his main health-care credential -- his co-authorship of a book entitled "Critical: What We Can Do About the Health Care Crisis."

headline.main: What Tom Daschle Would Bring to H.H.S.

docs.lead_paragraph: Over the last two years, Lawrence Summers, the intellectually fierce economist whom Barack Obama named this week as his lead economic adviser inside the White House, has carved out a role unlike anyone else's in the Democratic Party, The New York Times's David Leonhardt writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: When General Motors left Washington empty-handed last week, among the lingering questions was whether its huge pension fund could topple and crush the government's pension insurance program, The New York Times's Mary Williams Walsh writes.

headline.main: G.M.'s Pension Fund Stays Afloat, Against the Odds

docs.abstract: When General Motors left Washington empty-handed last week, among the lingering questions was whether its huge pension fund could topple and crush the government's pension insurance program, The New York Times's Mary Williams Walsh writes.
